meanings.definition: More flexible or able to bend easily.
meanings.sent1: The rubber band was bendier than the metal ruler.
meanings.sent2: She chose the bendier straw to drink her juice.
meanings.sent3: The bendier tree branch decided to do yoga to show off its flexibility.
meanings.sent4: His mind was bendier than a contortionist, adapting to new ideas effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The bendier gymnast wowed the crowd with her incredible backbend.

meanings.definition: Comparative form of bend, meaning more inclined to bend or flex.
meanings.sent1: The bendier road led us through the scenic route.
meanings.sent2: The bendier wire was easier to shape into a heart.
meanings.sent3: The bendier ruler enjoyed playing pranks by pretending to be a snake.
meanings.sent4: His morals were bendier than a slinky, always changing with the situation.
meanings.sent5: The bendier tree in the forest swayed gracefully in the wind.
